== Early life ==

sentences: Early life ==
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Allyson Brooke Hernandez was born on July 7, 1993 in San Antonio, Texas, where she was raised by parents Jerry Hernandez and Patricia Castillo.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: She has an older brother, Brandon.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Brooke was a 6-week-premature baby, weighing in at one pound and fourteen ounces when she was born.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: She is of Mexican descent but did not grow up speaking Spanish, as her parents decided to prevent her from being discriminated against in school.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Brooke attended Cornerstone Christian Elementary School in San Antonio, and completed her high school education through home-schooling.
section: == Early life ==

== Career == | === The X Factor and Fifth Harmony ===

sentences: Brooke auditioned for The X Factor in Austin, Texas, not far from her hometown in San Antonio, singing "On My Knees" from contemporary Christian and Latin pop singer Jaci Velasquez.
section: == Career == | === The X Factor and Fifth Harmony ===

sentences: For her bootcamp round she sang against Julia Bullock singing "Knockin' on Heaven's Door".
section: == Career == | === The X Factor and Fifth Harmony ===

sentences: She was eliminated during the bootcamp round of competition, but was brought back along with Dinah Jane, Normani, Lauren Jauregui, and Camila Cabello to form the group now known as Fifth Harmony.
section: == Career == | === The X Factor and Fifth Harmony ===

sentences: The group advanced to the live shows and managed to finish in third place.
section: == Career == | === The X Factor and Fifth Harmony ===

sentences: Her grandfather died during the week 4 performance of "Stronger (What Doesn't Kill You)" by Kelly Clarkson.
section: == Career == | === The X Factor and Fifth Harmony ===

sentences: After the finale of The X Factor, Fifth Harmony was signed to Syco Music and Epic Records.
section: == Career == | === The X Factor and Fifth Harmony ===

sentences: The group released their first Extended Play (EP), Better Together in 2013, along with the albums Reflection in 2015 and 7/27 in 2016.
section: == Career == | === The X Factor and Fifth Harmony ===

sentences: They released their self-titled third studio album Fifth Harmony on August 25, 2017.
section: == Career == | === The X Factor and Fifth Harmony ===

sentences: On March 19, 2018, the group announced an indefinite hiatus to focus on their solo projects.
section: == Career == | === The X Factor and Fifth Harmony ===
